result.execSummary:
The defendant Trace J McKay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:00 P.M. - Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Bielski raises the possiblility of ineffective assistance of counsel.  Court adjourns sentencing to 3/30/16 at 10:30 to allow time for filing of motions (to be filed within 10 days) to advance such a claim.  Motions will be addressed on 3/30/16 prior to sentencing.   Bond is revoked; def. to be held without bond.  $5,000.00 cash bond to be returned to the poster.

11:00 A.M. - Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Bielski requests time to review PSI with def.  Sentencing reset for today at 2:00.  Bond continued.

NOTE - deft's sentences in Racine were vacated due to the State's breach of the plea agreement.  Deft awaiting assignment of new judge/sentencing date in Racine.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Atty Ayers moves to w/draw as counsel.  Motion to withdraw is granted.  Status set for 11/19/15 @ 2:30pm.  Court amends the deft's bond to $20,000 cash.  Same conditions.  NOTE - deft already has $5,000 posted; an additional $15,000 cash is needed for release.
To Withdraw as Counsel - filed by Atty Carmen Lassiter

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Defense requests an adjournment; deft has a pending Racine case which is set for sentencing in December.  State objects to the adjournment.  Court denies the adjournment request.  Atty Lassiter reports the deft now wants to withdraw his plea and proceed to trial.  State objects.  Brief arguments heard.  Motion denied.  Sentencing arguments made by the State, defense counsel, & deft.  Additional discussion held.  Defense will have five days to file a written motion to withdraw his plea.  MH set for 10/23/15 @ 11am.  If the motion is denied, the parties shall be prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Defense requests an adjournment; just received the PSI and has not had to review it with the deft.  Deft is presently incarcerated in Racine.  Sentencing adj to 10/15/15 @ 2pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 4; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 9/17/15 @ 11am
